name: Days Inn Des Moines – West Clive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would agree the place is 'tired' but clean and we found everything worked. There was a problem with a light bulb and wrong size bed sheet but both were resolved quickly. The breakfast choice wasn't as varied as some but fine.
reviews.title: Staff really helpful.

reviews.text: I agree with the review that the rooms are very small. Old, old TVS, Wifi would not work on any of our phones, kindle,computer. The bathroom toilet was so high that my feet couldn't touch the floor. The toilet kept plugging up and reeked of sewer. The air/heater kept turning on and off, never allowing the room to keep a comfortable temp.
reviews.title: Just not feeling the love

reviews.text: This may have been an out of the ordinary experience, but there was a car that was parked at the end of our building with two men sitting in it. When my husband took our boxer out , they tried to strike up a conversation with him...my husband just kept to himself....They sat there for over an hour and a half,,just sitting ..... Weird I thought..... Later the police pulled in and arrested a man walking around the parking lot..weird again.
reviews.title: Too much in a small room

reviews.text: To be fair, the beds were okay,We really like the drive up doors and they accept pets.
reviews.title: Bates Motel!!!! Beware
This place is disgusting
reviews.text: There is a short drive to several restaurants, gas stations, shopping, the location is fine and there are lots of hotels all around this one, which we will try the next time.
Very comfortable. Had a king size bed and it was great. Wish I had a microwave. The map to this property was incorrect and traveled way out of my way to get there. No discount from staff.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Arrived at 4 p.m. could not check in to room until 4:30 p.m. Entered the room and it was very dingy smelling. Kicked off our shoes only to find the carpeting all wet! Sheets did not fit either bed. 1/2 roll toilet paper in the bathroom. Mold under soad holder in shower. Bathtub stained black. Fridge made horrible noise. Floor by bed had sinkhole. Shower floor felt like it would cave in. No guide for tv. Most channels said unavailable. Wifi connection horrible. Pool full of leaves and water very murky. Leaves not netted the 2 days we were there. Arrived back in the room from our evening out and the air condition unit had died. Called front desk, answered by a rude man telling me I should have called earlier and there was nothing he could do. I exp. we were out all evening and it WAS working. Hot, sweaty non night sleep! Only given a $10 discount! Seeing other reviews I will from now on check reviews before booking any room anywhere! This hotel needs lessons in customer service!!
reviews.title: Very bad room and customer service.

reviews.text: Staff was very nice (Colleen, Erica and Heidi) and enjoyed the breakfast. Rooms were nice, clean and VERY affordable. Would definitely stay there again! Nothing fancy, just a good place to sleep (Great bed). We checked in at 4 pm and had to perform live music. Got back to the motel around 2 am and slept well, until a maintenance guy started cleaning the sidewalks outside our rooms around 9:30 am. Checked out at 10:40 am and went to our next destination.
reviews.title: Nice and reasonable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our very last trip across country going to my husbands 45th high school reunion in Frankenmuth, Michigan. Fantastic trip UNTIL ...
reviews.title: From Las Vegas to Michigan

reviews.text: We arrived late and left early at this property, so we didn't have much time to explore. Our only experience was with the lobby and the room. Both were acceptable - typical Day's Inn. The female clerk at the desk was especially helpful when I had questions about wi-fi access and needing a corkscrew. She was very competent and friendly - may have been the night manager.
reviews.title: Worn and dated, but still works

reviews.text: The room was small, and the furnishings appeared quite worn, dated, and ready for retirement. Tube TV (not flat screen) - I thought most hotels had gotten rid of those relics but not here. The bed was overly soft, in my opinion. The room was clean, however, and suited our needs for the short amount of time we were there. I would probably get claustrophobia if I had to stay too many nights there. Not much room to move around at all.
reviews.title: We wouldn't stay here again

aka: Days Inn Clive Valley West Hotel Clive
